alert.note: Alert for Uintah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 12:09PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Utah... Duchesne River near Randlett affecting Uintah County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river and stream flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by snowmelt will continue. * WHERE...Duchesne River near Randlett. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, minor flooding is expected across low-lying agricultural land along the Duchesne River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to oscillate above bankfull conditions through the weekend. - Action stage is 11.6 feet. - Flood stage is 13.3 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
